code: @Manual{,   title = {OCepi: Collection of Common Data Cleaning Tools for Epidemiologists},   author = {Eric Shearer},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://ericmshearer.github.io/OCepi/}, }

what: Collection of Common Data Cleaning Tools for Epidemiologists
title: Collection of Common Data Cleaning Tools for Epidemiologists
text: {OCepi} aims provide standardized approach mundane data wrangling tasks public health epidemiologists. functions included package can broadly applied made specifically epidemiologists county State agencies. package addresses following priorities: standardization recoding demographic data, specifically: ethnicity/race, gender, sexual orientation, age groups ggplot2 extensions elevate data visualizations convert dates weeks, months, years following CDC MMWR schema

title: Collection of Common Data Cleaning Tools for Epidemiologists
text: latest development version:

title: Collection of Common Data Cleaning Tools for Epidemiologists
text: Simplest ways contact : Questions/Feedback: ericshearer@.com Issues/Bugs: https://github.com/ericmshearer/OCepi/issues

title: Add Proportion — add_percent
text: Calculate percentage per category options round multiply 100.

title: Add Proportion — add_percent
text: n Count/frequency variable. digits Number digits round. multiply Boolean TRUE/FALSE multiply proportion 100.

title: Add Proportion — add_percent
text: Proportion.

title: Add Proportion — add_percent
code: df <- data.frame(species = c("Droid","Human","Wookie"), n = c(3,12,1)) df$percent <- add_percent(df$n) df #>   species  n percent #> 1   Droid  3   18.75 #> 2   Human 12   75.00 #> 3  Wookie  1    6.25

title: Create age groups. — age_groups
text: Add age groups column using common age grouping presets. R Markdown documentation list presets.

title: Create age groups. — age_groups
text: age_var Age variable numeric format. type Specify preset use.

title: Create age groups. — age_groups
text: Age groups factor.

title: Create age groups. — age_groups
code: df <- data.frame(Age = sample(0:99, 100)) df$agegrps <- age_groups(df$Age, type = "covid") head(df) #>   Age agegrps #> 1  44   35-44 #> 2  22   18-24 #> 3  75   75-84 #> 4  62   55-64 #> 5  46   45-54 #> 6  30   25-34

Clean patient/record address — clean_address
text: Recode common address issues cardinal directions street names, removes extra location information unit apartment number.

title: Clean patient/record address — clean_address
text: address_var Address variable. keep_extra Defaults TRUE. Option keep/remove extra address components (e.g. Apartment, Unit, Space).

title: Clean patient/record address — clean_address
text: Address character.

title: Clean patient/record address — clean_address
code: x = "1234 N Main St Apt 405" clean_address(x, keep_extra = TRUE) #> [1] "1234 North Main Street Apartment 405" clean_address(x, keep_extra = FALSE) #> [1] "1234 North Main Street"

title: Clean Phone Number — clean_phone

title: Clean Phone Number — clean_phone
text: Reformatted phone number.

what: Subset Data To Label Line Plot — end_points
title: Subset Data To Label Line Plot — end_points
text: Subset dataframe label last point geom_line. Function takes account time series end time point.

title: Subset Data To Label Line Plot — end_points
Subset Data To Label Line Plot — end_points
text: df Dataframe date Date column used plot - can date, year, week. group_by time series end different dates, specify group variable.

title: Subset Data To Label Line Plot — end_points
text: Dataframe filtered maximum (recent) date including groups date.

title: Subset Data To Label Line Plot — end_points
code: df <- data.frame(Date = seq.Date(from = as.Date("2023-01-01"), to = as.Date("2023-12-01"), by = "month"), scores = sample(65:99, 12)) end_points(df, Date) #>          Date scores #> 12 2023-12-01     90

title: Dumbbell Plot — geom_dumbbell
text: Dumbbell plot using ggplot2. Arose need create timelines.

title: Dumbbell Plot — geom_dumbbell
code: geom_dumbbell(   data = NULL,   mapping = NULL,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   position = "identity",   na.rm = FALSE,   colour_x = NULL,   colour_xend = NULL,   size = NULL,   linewidth = NULL,   colour = NULL,   ... )  GeomDumbbell

title: Dumbbell Plot — geom_dumbbell
text: object class GeomDumbbell (inherits Geom, ggproto, gg) length 7.

title: Dumbbell Plot — geom_dumbbell
text: data Dataframe. mapping Requires following aesthetics: x = starting point, xend = ending point, y = category/factor. show.legend Boolean. inherit.aes TRUE combine default mapping top level plot. position Default set "identity". na.rm Boolean remove NA values. colour_x Color starting point. colour_xend Color ending point. size Size points. linewidth Line thickness. colour Line color. ... args, man.

title: Dumbbell Plot — geom_dumbbell
text: Dumbbell plot.

title: Dumbbell Plot — geom_dumbbell
code: library(ggplot2) df <- data.frame(Country = c("UK-A","US-A","UK-B","US-B"), PRE = c(0,1,2,3), POST = c(4,5,6,7)) ggplot(data = df, aes(x = PRE, xend = POST, y = Country)) +  geom_dumbbell(colour_x = "blue", colour_xend = "red", size = 3, linewidth = 3, colour = "black") +  labs(title = "Dumbbell Plot", x = "Pre/Post Scores", y = "Country")

title: Lollipop Plot — geom_lollipop
code: geom_lollipop(   data = NULL,   mapping = NULL,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   position = "identity",   na.rm = FALSE,   linewidth = NULL,   ... )  GeomLollipop

title: Lollipop Plot — geom_lollipop
text: object class GeomLollipop (inherits Geom, ggproto, gg) length 7.

title: Lollipop Plot — geom_lollipop
text: data Dataframe mapping x y mapping. show.legend Boolean. inherit.aes TRUE combine default mapping top level plot. position Default set "identity". na.rm Boolean remove NA values. linewidth Change linewidth. ... arguments!

title: Lollipop Plot — geom_lollipop
text: Lollipop plot.

title: Lollipop Plot — geom_lollipop
code: df <- data.frame(locations = letters[1:5], scores = c(90,82,87,91,74))  ggplot(data = df, aes(x = locations, y = scores)) +  geom_lollipop(size = 10, linewidth = 2, color = "red")

title: Highlight Geom Using Expression — highlight_geom
text: Highlight bar, point, line plot based expression.

title: Highlight Geom Using Expression — highlight_geom
text: expr Expression pal color highlighted geom size Point size using geom_point alpha Alpha transparency linewidth Linewidth using geom_line geom_sf

title: Highlight Geom Using Expression — highlight_geom
text: ggplot2 highlighted layer

title: Highlight Geom Using Expression — highlight_geom
code: df <- data.frame(locations = letters[1:5], scores = c(80,84,91,89,80)) ggplot(data = df, aes(x = locations, y = scores)) + geom_col() + highlight_geom(scores==max(scores), pal = "#9E0059")

what: Highlight Keywords in ggplot2 Title — highlight_title
title: Highlight Keywords in ggplot2 Title — highlight_title
text: building ggplot using highlight_geom, may need color word title draw focus. Function depends ggtext::element_markdown() added theme plot.

title: Highlight Keywords in ggplot2 Title — highlight_title
Highlight Keywords in ggplot2 Title — highlight_title
text: text Title, string. words Named vector word(s) hex code.

title: Highlight Keywords in ggplot2 Title — highlight_title
text: Title highlighted word/words.

title: Highlight Keywords in ggplot2 Title — highlight_title
code: if (FALSE) { df <- data.frame(locations = letters[1:5], events = c(20,24,19,12,33)) ggplot(data = df, aes(x = locations, y = events)) + geom_col() +  labs(    title = highlight_title("New Title Goes Here FRIEND", words = c("New"="#d55c19"))  ) +  theme(    plot.title = ggtext::element_markdown()  )  }

title: Redact HIV/AIDS from Dataframe — hiv_redact
text: Convert manual process redacting sensitive health information. Works exclusively dataframes.

title: Redact HIV/AIDS from Dataframe — hiv_redact
text: df Dataframe HIV/AIDS removed.

title: Redact HIV/AIDS from Dataframe — hiv_redact
text: Dataframe. Warning message printed console HIV/AIDS data detected.

title: Redact HIV/AIDS from Dataframe — hiv_redact
code: df <- data.frame(cause = c("cancer","hepatitis","COVID-19","HIV")) hiv_redact(df) #> Warning: HIV/AIDS data detected. #>       cause #> 1    cancer #> 2 hepatitis #> 3  COVID-19 #> 4

what: Date to MMWR Disease Week — mmwr_week
title: Date to MMWR Disease Week — mmwr_week
text: Following CDC MMWR schema, calculate week number based input date.

title: Date to MMWR Disease Week — mmwr_week
Date to MMWR Disease Week — mmwr_week
text: date Input date .e. episode date, specimen collection date.

title: Date to MMWR Disease Week — mmwr_week
text: Epidemiological week per MMWR schema.

title: Date to MMWR Disease Week — mmwr_week
text: CDC: first day MMWR week Sunday. MMWR week numbering sequential beginning 1 incrementing week maximum 52 53. MMWR week #1 MMWR year first week year least four days calendar year. example, January 1 occurs Sunday, Monday, Tuesday Wednesday, calendar week includes January 1 MMWR week #1. January 1 occurs Thursday, Friday, Saturday, calendar week includes January 1 last MMWR week previous year (#52 #53). rule, December 29, 30, 31 potentially fall MMWR week #1 following MMWR year.

title: Date to MMWR Disease Week — mmwr_week
Date to MMWR Year — mmwr_year
text: Following CDC MMWR schema, calculate year based input date.

title: Date to MMWR Year — mmwr_year
text: date Input date .e. episode date, specimen collection date.

title: Date to MMWR Year — mmwr_year
text: Epidemiological year per MMWR schema.

title: Date to MMWR Year — mmwr_year
text: CDC: first day MMWR week Sunday. MMWR week numbering sequential beginning 1 incrementing week maximum 52 53. MMWR week #1 MMWR year first week year least four days calendar year. example, January 1 occurs Sunday, Monday, Tuesday Wednesday, calendar week includes January 1 MMWR week #1. January 1 occurs Thursday, Friday, Saturday, calendar week includes January 1 last MMWR week previous year (#52 #53). rule, December 29, 30, 31 potentially fall MMWR week #1 following MMWR year.

Recode Race/Ethnicity — recode_race
text: Simplify race/ethnicity patient data one variable using CalREDIE, CAIR2, VRBIS datasets. Hierarchy defaults Hispanic/Latinx regardless reported race. Function can handle one (e.g. CAIR2) two inputs (e.g. CalREDIE). using VRBIS dataset, expected input "Multi-status Race" column.

title: Recode Race/Ethnicity — recode_race
text: ethnicity_col Patient ethnicity variable. race_col Patient race variable. abbr_names TRUE/FALSE, option abbreviate long category names.

title: Recode Race/Ethnicity — recode_race
text: Merged race/ethnicity variable.

title: Recode Race/Ethnicity — recode_race
code: recode_race("Hispanic","Black or African American") #> [1] "Hispanic/Latinx" recode_race("Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander", abbr_names = FALSE) #> [1] "Native Hawaiian/Other Pacific Islander" recode_race("1") #> [1] "White"

title: Remove Empty Columns — remove_empty_cols
text: Ability drop columns either completely NA "".

title: Remove Empty Columns — remove_empty_cols
text: df Input dataframe.

title: Remove Empty Columns — remove_empty_cols
text: Dataframe blank/empty columns removed. Message printed console total columns removed.

title: Remove Empty Columns — remove_empty_cols
code: test <- data.frame(a = c(NA,NA,NA), b = c("","",""), c = c(1,2,3)) test <- remove_empty_cols(test) #> 2 columns dropped. test #>   c #> 1 1 #> 2 2 #> 3 3

what: Data Suppression for Low Category Frequencies — suppress
title: Data Suppression for Low Category Frequencies — suppress
text: Mask values/counts specified threshold maintain patient confidentiality.

title: Data Suppression for Low Category Frequencies — suppress
Data Suppression for Low Category Frequencies — suppress
text: n Input field suppressed. less_than Maximum value suppression. replace_with Value use input field suppressed. String, numeric, NA.

title: Data Suppression for Low Category Frequencies — suppress
text: Suppressed value.

title: Data Suppression for Low Category Frequencies — suppress
code: df <- data.frame(Counts = c(5, 1, 10, 3, 12, 9, 4)) df$Counts_Suppressed <- suppress(df$Counts, less_than = 5, replace_with = "**") df #>   Counts Counts_Suppressed #> 1      5                 5 #> 2      1                ** #> 3     10                10 #> 4      3                ** #> 5     12                12 #> 6      9                 9 #> 7      4                **

text: Standardized method determine death belongs local health jurisdiction.

code: vrbis_resident(   death_location,   county_of_death,   county_fips,   fips = "059",   county_code = "30" )

title: Algorithm for Death Certificate Inclusion — vrbis_resident
text: death_location Expects "Place Death (Facility)" column VRBIS dataset. county_of_death Expects "County Death (Code)" column. county_fips Expects "Decedents County Residence (NCHS Code)" column. fips County fips code local health jurisdiction. county_code State county code per Appendix G CCDF data dictionary.

title: Algorithm for Death Certificate Inclusion — vrbis_resident

title: Wrap Long Axis Labels — wrap_labels
text: Wrap long axis labels avoid overcrowding.

title: Wrap Long Axis Labels — wrap_labels
text: width Higher value = less wrapping, lower value = wrapping. Recommended width 15.

title: Wrap Long Axis Labels — wrap_labels
text: Wrapped labels.

title: Wrap Long Axis Labels — wrap_labels
code: df <- data.frame(group = c("Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander", "Black or African American","American Indian or Alaska Native"), score = c(89.5, 84, 73))  ggplot(data = df, aes(x = group, y = score)) +  geom_col() +  scale_x_discrete(labels = wrap_labels(width = 15))
